definitions.definition: The condition of being impure; because of contamination, pollution, adulteration or insufficient purification.
definitions.example: Even animals in the Jewish system cause impurity only when they are dead.

definitions.definition: A component or additive that renders something else impure.
definitions.example: The impurities in the iron ore made extraction of the iron very difficult.

definitions.definition: A state of immorality or sin; especially the weakness of the flesh: inchastity.
definitions.example: With his cheating, lying and stealing, he epitomised the impurity of humanity.
